instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3462: What is 820-3462? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.R7402: What is R7402? Resistor between PPVIN_S0_CPUIMVP and CPUIMVP_TON. TON stands for TIME ON â€“ CPUIMVP_TON configures the buck converter for the CPU based on its input power supply. If this resistor is blown, the machine will turn on but not have any image, chime, or POST, because CPU vcore will be missing. This resistor is often the first to corrode because it is along a high voltage rail and it is right on the edge of the board, check this on 2011-2012 model Macbook Pros that turn on and do not chime. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: THIS MACHINE TURNS ON THE FAN FOR 4 SECONDS IT COMES BACK AND TURNS ON THE FAN CYCLICLY, CAN YOU HELP ME WHAT MEASURES TO TAKE

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Any histoy available?
Did you test the board alone on the desk?
Be sure to use original 60/85W Magsafe 2 charger.

Check for voltage on all big coils.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Any histoy available? not
I use original 60w Magsafe 2 charger
Did you test the board alone on the desk? only board with magsafe board
L7030=12.56v
L7030=3.3v
L7030=cycle from 0 to 5v
l7330=cycle from 0 to 1.5v
L7630=cycle
l7520=0v
l7510=0v
L7630=0v
L7630=0v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
"L7030=12.56v
L7030=3.3v
L7030=cycle from 0 to 5v"
Not really sure what this means.
I was expecting to get some voltages, when fan spins.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
L7030=12.56V ESTABLE
L7030=3.3V ESTABLE
L7030= el voltaje  varia rapidamente subiendo de 0 hasta 5v y vuelve y cae nuevamente y vuelve otra vez a subir hasta 5v asi sucesivamente
el ventilador gira pero se reinicia constantemente

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Como puedes tener tres escenarios de tension en L7030, cundo el fan gira?
en ese tiempo, no hay tension en otras bobinas?
Al menos 5V deben aparecer, para el fan.

Mide todo lo que puedas en placa, cuando <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> tiene 12.5V.
Asegurate no tener corto en alguna bobina, o linea d power secundaia.
Revisa pag 64 y 65.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
lo siento me equivoque en la enumeracion bobinas :( 
L7030=12.56
L7260=3.3V
L7220= el voltaje varia rapidamente subiendo de 0 hasta 5v y vuelve y cae nuevamente y vuelve otra vez a subir hasta 5v asi sucesivamente
el ventilador gira pero se reinicia constantemente
l7330=CICLO 0 to 1.5v constantemente
l7630=ciclo 
l7520=0v
l7510=0v
L7630=0v
L7630=0v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Asegurate de tener cargador 60/85W Magsafe 2 original.
Prueba tambien arranque en SMC bypass.
Revisa modo diodo en las bobinas donde no hay pulso de tension.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
modo diodo en bobinas donde no hay pulso tension
l7520=0.004
l7510=0.004
L7550=0.003
l7560=0.003

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Compara los valores con una placa funcional.
Revisa <RESISTOR>R7402</RESISTOR>/03 y las tensiones basicas de <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>.
